headline: Iron Mountain (IRM): $221.6M One-Off Loss Reinforces Margin Recovery Debate
summary: Iron Mountain (IRM) reported net profit margins of just 0.6%, down sharply from 3.9% the previous year. Earnings have declined by 21.3% per year over the past five years. A one-off loss of $221.6 million weighed heavily on recent results and led to negative earnings growth for the year. While profitability has taken a hit, the focus for investors is now on optimism around strong forecasted earnings momentum and a share price trading below estimated fair value. See our full analysis for Iron...
